document.docOrigin: Journal of Natural History (J. Nat. Hist.) 51 (7 - 8)
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the carpenter bee subgenus Xylocopa (Dasyxylocopa) (Hymenoptera: Apidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the carpenter bee subgenus Xylocopa (Dasyxylocopa) (Hymenoptera: Apidae)

bibRefCitation.author: Friese H
bibRefCitation.refString: Friese H. 1903. Neue Arten der Bienengattung Xylocopa Latr. aus der neotropischen und orientalischen Region (Hym.). Z Syst Hymenopterol Dipterol. 3: 202 - 208.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Xylocopa bimaculata
Friese, 1903: 202
. Holotype female, Brazil : Rio Grande do Sul (ZMB; examined).

subSubSection.paragraph:
The name
X. bimaculata
is used here to encompass only the populations from southern Brazil (additional records also known from northern Argentina and Paraguay ; see Hurd 1978 , p. 15), with the other available names removed from its synonymy (see
X. piligera
below). This species is most similar to
X. piligera
, with the main differences between them indicated in the key above.
The taxon was proposed based on a single female specimen, currently housed in the ZMB collection. The holotype is in perfect condition ( Figure 1 ).
